thoughts.content: I'm going to fail this presentation tomorrow and everyone will think I'm incompetent
thoughts.reframe: I've prepared well and even if I make some mistakes, that's normal. My colleagues are supportive and understand that presentations can be challenging.

thoughts.content: My coworkers probably think I'm stupid because I asked that question in the meeting
thoughts.reframe: Asking questions shows I'm engaged and want to understand. I have no evidence anyone thinks poorly of me, and clarifying questions are valuable.

thoughts.content: I made a mistake in the report. I'm such an idiot and my boss will be disappointed
thoughts.reframe: Everyone makes mistakes. I caught it and can fix it. One error doesn't define my capabilities or my boss's view of me.

thoughts.content: I'm falling behind on this project. I'll never catch up and I'm going to get fired
thoughts.reframe: I can break this down into smaller tasks and make steady progress. Being behind doesn't mean failure, and I can ask for help if needed.

thoughts.content: My boss didn't reply to my email yet. They must be upset with my work
thoughts.reframe: There are many reasons for a delayed response. I have no evidence of dissatisfaction, and assuming the worst isn't helpful.

thoughts.content: I should be further along in my career by now. I'm a complete failure
thoughts.reframe: Everyone's career path is different. I've accomplished meaningful things, and comparing myself to arbitrary timelines isn't fair or productive.

thoughts.content: My colleague got promoted and I didn't. I'm never going to advance in my job
thoughts.reframe: Promotions depend on many factors and timing. My turn will come, and I can focus on continuing to develop my skills.

thoughts.content: Everyone at the party will think I'm boring and awkward
thoughts.reframe: I don't know what people will think, and it's okay to be myself. Most people are focused on their own experience, not judging me.

thoughts.content: I said something weird in that conversation. They probably think I'm strange now
thoughts.reframe: Everyone says things that feel awkward sometimes. It's likely they've already forgotten about it, and one comment doesn't define how they see me.

thoughts.content: My friend hasn't texted me back in two days. They must be mad at me
thoughts.reframe: People get busy. There's no evidence they're upset, and assuming the worst damages my peace of mind unnecessarily.

thoughts.content: I wasn't invited to that gathering. Nobody actually likes me
thoughts.reframe: Not being invited to one event doesn't mean people dislike me. There could be many reasons, and I have other friends who value my company.

thoughts.content: If I go to the meetup, I'll say something embarrassing and everyone will judge me
thoughts.reframe: I can't predict the future, and even if I'm nervous, that's okay. Most people are welcoming and understanding of social discomfort.

thoughts.content: I should be more outgoing and confident. There's something wrong with me
thoughts.reframe: Personality traits vary naturally. Being more reserved is valid, and I don't need to change who I am to be acceptable.

thoughts.content: I have a headache. It's probably a brain tumor and I'm going to die
thoughts.reframe: Headaches are common and usually benign. If it persists, I can see a doctor, but jumping to worst-case scenarios isn't helpful.

thoughts.content: My chest feels tight. I must be having a heart attack
thoughts.reframe: Anxiety can cause physical sensations like chest tightness. I can take deep breaths and see if it subsides. If I'm truly concerned, I can get checked.

thoughts.content: I read about this disease online. I definitely have all the symptoms
thoughts.reframe: Many symptoms are common to multiple conditions. Medical information online can be misleading, and if I'm concerned, I should consult a professional.

thoughts.content: I feel exhausted all the time. Something must be seriously wrong with me
thoughts.reframe: Fatigue can have many causes like stress, sleep, or lifestyle. I can track my symptoms and discuss with a doctor if it continues.

thoughts.content: I got a B on the exam. I'm a complete failure
thoughts.reframe: A B is a good grade. One test doesn't define my abilities, and perfectionism only increases my stress without adding value.

thoughts.content: My apartment is messy. I should have everything organized perfectly or I'm lazy
thoughts.reframe: Everyone's home gets messy sometimes. I can clean gradually, and having a lived-in space doesn't make me lazy.

thoughts.content: I made a typo in that message. They'll think I'm careless and unprofessional
thoughts.reframe: Small mistakes happen to everyone. One typo doesn't determine how professional I am, and most people understand that.

thoughts.content: If I can't do this project perfectly, there's no point in trying at all
thoughts.reframe: Done is better than perfect. I can do my best without requiring perfection, and trying has value even if the outcome isn't flawless.

thoughts.content: My partner seems distant today. They're definitely going to break up with me
thoughts.reframe: People have off days for many reasons. I can ask how they're doing instead of assuming the worst about our relationship.

thoughts.content: We had an argument. Our relationship is ruined and it's all my fault
thoughts.reframe: Disagreements are normal in relationships. We can talk through this, and it takes two people to have an argument.

thoughts.content: I spent money on something I didn't need. I'm terrible with money and I'll end up broke
thoughts.reframe: One purchase doesn't define my financial habits. I can learn from this and make different choices going forward.

thoughts.content: Everything always goes wrong for me. Nothing ever works out
thoughts.reframe: I'm focusing only on negatives. Many things have gone well in my life, and temporary setbacks don't mean permanent failure.

thoughts.content: I feel anxious, which means something bad is definitely going to happen
thoughts.reframe: Feelings aren't facts. Anxiety is just a sensation, not evidence that something bad will occur. I can feel anxious and still be safe.

thoughts.content: I got the award, but it doesn't really count. They probably just felt sorry for me
thoughts.reframe: I earned this recognition through my work. Dismissing my achievement doesn't serve me, and I have no evidence people felt sorry for me.

thoughts.content: I finished the marathon, but I wasn't fast enough. It doesn't really count
thoughts.reframe: Completing a marathon is a significant accomplishment regardless of time. I should celebrate what I achieved rather than diminish it.

thoughts.content: My team missed the deadline. It's entirely my fault as the lead
thoughts.reframe: Many factors contribute to project outcomes. While I'm responsible as lead, the team shares accountability, and I did my best.

thoughts.content: My child got a bad grade. I'm a terrible parent
thoughts.reframe: Children's academic performance has many factors. One grade doesn't reflect my parenting, and I can support them without taking full blame.
